main event: The report contains multiple UFO sightings, most notably one in Oklahoma City where witnesses reported circular objects hovering at an estimated 2000 ft. altitude before rapidly accelerating and disappearing. Another sighting in Albin, Wyoming, involved an object that disappeared into the clouds and overcast after being observed through binoculars.
interesting points: The circular objects observed in Oklahoma City were described as 40 to 50 ft. in diameter and remained stationary for about 15 minutes before accelerating rapidly.
In Albin, Wyoming, the object disappeared into the clouds and overcast after being observed through binoculars at dusk.
The report includes data such as altitude, wind speed, and directions at different altitudes for some sightings.
Multiple sources and witnesses are cited throughout the report, adding credibility to the observations.
There are mentions of comet tails, orange-yellow lights, and slow movements in various sightings.
sighted object: circular objects in the sky, an object disappearing into the clouds and overcast
location: Oklahoma City, OK; Albin, WY; United States & Canada
witnesses: Clara Fell, William and Wesley Christian, William B. Hancover, Mr. and Mrs. [REDACTED]
